Variables

usbCanState UsbCanStateToSet
 

Detailed Description

This is the main scene used when an application mode is entered. It will mainly run MODEL component and display related informations using VIEW component.

Function Documentation

◆ usb_can_scene_set_state()

void usb_can_scene_set_state ( usbCanState  state)

This function is called by usb_can_scene_start_var_list_enter_callback when an application mode is entered. It set UsbCanStateToSet.

This function is called by usb_can_scene_start_var_list_enter_callback when an application mode (USB-LOOPBACK-TEST, USB-CAN-BRIGE, CAN-TEST) by the user in the application main menu.

Definition at line 22 of file usbCan_scene_usb_can.cpp.

◆ usb_can_scene_usb_can_callback()

void usb_can_scene_usb_can_callback ( UsbCanCustomEvent  event,
void *  context 
)

This function is a callback registered in VIEW module via usb_can_scene_usb_can_on_enter.

This function is a callback registered in VIEW module via usb_can_scene_usb_can_on_enter used to perform actions when events are sent by furi gui component. It basically forwards arguments to view dispatcher UsbCanApp::views -> UsbCanAppViews::view_dispatcher via view_dispatcher_send_custom_event. Then view dispatcher will call back usb_can_scene_usb_can_on_event to process event.

Definition at line 32 of file usbCan_scene_usb_can.cpp.

◆ usb_can_scene_usb_can_on_enter()

void usb_can_scene_usb_can_on_enter ( void *  context)

This function is called when an application mode is selected by the user in the application main menu. It mainly runs application logic by calling usb_can_enable().

This function is called by usb_can_scene_start_on_event() when an application mode (USB-LOOPBACK-TEST, USB-CAN-BRIGE, CAN-TEST) is selected by the user in the application main menu. It performs the following actions:

  1. call usb_can_enable() passing UsbCanStateToSet to set application mode in MODEL.
  2. register usb_can_scene_usb_can_callback callback in furi gui component via usb_can_view_set_callback
  3. request VIEW component to display USB CAN App custom view ( UsbCanAppViewUsbCan) by calling view_dispatcher_switch_to_view()
  4. call notification_message (with sequence_display_backlight_enforce_on argument)

Definition at line 47 of file usbCan_scene_usb_can.cpp.

◆ usb_can_scene_usb_can_on_event()

bool usb_can_scene_usb_can_on_event ( void *  context,
SceneManagerEvent  event 
)

Events are processed here : It will either go to config state or exit application running mode on depending on user input or refresh display.

Events forwarded by usb_can_scene_usb_can_callback through view dispatcher are processed here :

  • If user press left key : Enter in SCENE-CONFIG (and view) to configure VCP channel by calling scene_manager_next_scene with UsbCanSceneConfig argument.
  • If back key is pressed by the user : Exit this scene and stop MODEL component via usb_can_scene_usb_can_on_exit() by switching to usbCan_scene_exit_confirm by calling scene_manager_next_scene with UsbCanSceneExitConfirm argument.
  • If a tick event is signaled : refresh MODEL informations displayed to user by calling usb_can_view_update_state

Definition at line 63 of file usbCan_scene_usb_can.cpp.

◆ usb_can_scene_usb_can_on_exit()

void usb_can_scene_usb_can_on_exit ( void *  context)

This function is called by usb_can_scene_usb_can_on_event() via scene_manager and is used to stop MODEL component via usb_can_disable().

Variable Documentation

◆ UsbCanStateToSet

usbCanState UsbCanStateToSet

This is the application mode requested by the user through usb_can_scene_set_state. This requested state will be communicated to MODEL component through usb_can_scene_usb_can_on_enter function.
